spans.text: the valley : our enemies were appalled at the sound
The red armour of our warriors
the chase like stones of hail
the Hirlas of Rhys overflow like the waters of the great river
the carved Hirlas of mirth , which glows with livid gold
attend to the merits of the warriors , lest they revenge on thee the disgrace of their honour
to the merits of the warriors
he is the bulwark of the borders : sprung from Cynfyll and the dragons of the hill ; his name shall ever live in the songs of the bards
from Cynfyll and the dragons of the hill
as the battle of the champions of the valley
the Hirlas to Eadnyfed , who sits like a god upon his broken armour : like a tempest he fell upon the shields of his foes : near Gyrthyn he slew an host
the Hirlas to Eadnyfed , who sits like a god upon his broken armour : like a tempest he fell upon the shields of his foes : near Gyrthyn he slew an host
like a god upon his broken armour
the shields of his foes : near Gyrthyn he slew an host
the noise of the battle of Maelor
the mead be born to Sylliw , defender of our coast
next : strong as two rocks they raged in the fight ; the bravest champion falls before them
storms they pierce the targets of the foe
storms they pierce the targets of the foe
valour set upon their brows ; like wolves they sought for blood
the sight of his useless sword
the badge of honour , the golden Hirlas
the badge of honour , the golden Hirlas
him stand like a rock on the spreading plain of Giveshun
the sandy bank of the sea his attendants did wonders
their chief , strong as the spear of Uther , swift in pursuit as the vapours of the night
drink to the honour of the warriors , who fell in the war
go round to the warriors who fought at Llydcomb
to the warriors who fought at Llydcomb
